info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 10:15AM EST until January 29 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues along the French Broad River near Fletcher. * WHERE...Buncombe and Henderson Counties in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Isolated farmland flooding across the French Broad River Valley, from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site at Fletcher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1010 AM EST, Minor flooding was occurring in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River flows were elevated. - Flood impacts will continue through midday, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arden, Mills River, Fletcher, Mountain Home and Avery Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
